Detailed Description

Simple webserver application for demonstrating the RNDIS demo and TCP/IP stack. This application will serve up a static HTTP web page when requested by the host.

Function Documentation

static bool IsHTTPCommand ( uint8_t *  RequestHeader,
char *  Command 
) [static]

Indicates if a given request equals the given HTTP command.

Parameters:
[in] RequestHeader HTTP request made by the host
[in] Command HTTP command to compare the request to
Returns:
Boolean true if the command matches the request, false otherwise
void Webserver_ApplicationCallback ( TCP_ConnectionState_t *  ConnectionState,
TCP_ConnectionBuffer_t *  Buffer 
)

Application callback routine, executed each time the TCP processing task runs. This callback determines what request has been made (if any), and serves up appropriate responses.

Parameters:
[in] ConnectionState Pointer to a TCP Connection State structure giving connection information
[in,out] Buffer Pointer to the application's send/receive packet buffer
void Webserver_Init ( void   ) 

Initializes the Webserver application, opening the appropriate HTTP port in the TCP handler and registering the application callback routine for packets sent to the HTTP protocol port.

Variable Documentation

char PROGMEM HTTP200Header[]
Initial value:
 "HTTP/1.1 200 OK\r\n"
                               "Server: LUFA RNDIS\r\n"
                               "Content-type: text/html\r\n"
                               "Connection: close\r\n\r\n"

HTTP server response header, for transmission before the page contents. This indicates to the host that a page exists at the given location, and gives extra connection information.

char PROGMEM HTTP404Header[]
Initial value:
 "HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found\r\n"
                               "Server: LUFA RNDIS\r\n"
                               "Connection: close\r\n\r\n"
char PROGMEM HTTPPage[]
Initial value:
 
        "<html>"
        "   <head>"
        "       <title>"
        "           LUFA Webserver Demo"
        "       </title>"
        "   </head>"
        "   <body>"
        "       <h1>Hello from your USB AVR!</h1>"
        "       <p>"
        "           Hello! Welcome to the LUFA RNDIS Demo Webserver test page, running on your USB AVR via the LUFA library. This demonstrates the HTTP webserver, TCP/IP stack and RNDIS demo all running atop the LUFA USB stack."
        "           <br /><br />"
        "           <small>Project Information: <a href=\"http://www.fourwalledcubicle.com/LUFA.php\">http://www.fourwalledcubicle.com/LUFA.php</a>.</small>"
        "           <hr />"
        "           <i>LUFA Version: </i>" LUFA_VERSION_STRING
        "       </p>"
        "   </body>"
        "</html>"

HTTP page to serve to the host when a HTTP request is made. This page is too long for a single response, thus it is automatically broken up into smaller blocks and sent as a series of packets each time the webserver application callback is run.
